Package chess

Class Chess

java.lang.Object
chess.Chess
public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
Main class of Chess application. Initializes and defines functions for playing and printing the Chess game and fields for the Board representation.
Author:
Pavan Mahankali, Joshua Su

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

    • checkcheckmate

      public static boolean checkcheckmate​(boolean white)
      Checks if specified player is in checkmate by calling move for all possible moves to escape check, and returns true if none exist.
      Parameters:
      white - player to check (true if white, false if black)
      Returns:
      true if said player is in checkmate, false otherwise

    • initialize

      public static void initialize()
      Creates all the pieces of the Chess game and sets them to their starting positions.

    • move

      public static boolean move​(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Moves a piece from specified starting position to ending position by first evaluating legality of move, and then executing move if legal

      Legality is determined by whether position coordinates return true from inbound(int x, int y) and are contained in array returned by getLegalMoves(int startX, int startY).

      If legal, piece is moved to specified ending position and the board is updated. If movement results in the player's King placed in check, the board is reverted and the function returns false.

      Parameters:
      startX - the horizontal position of the starting position
      startY - the vertical position of the starting position
      endX - the horizontal position of the ending position
      endY - the vertical position of the ending position
      Returns:
      true if move is valid and the movement does not place player's King in check, false otherwise.

    • castlemove

      public static boolean castlemove​(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Function to define a castling move, called from move with specified starting and ending positions. The castling move evaluates whether King moves through check in successive move calls, reverting if move returns false, or completing the castling by updating Board with the King and Rook in their ending positions.

      The legality of the castling move otherwise is handled before this function is called.

      Parameters:
      startX - the horizontal position of the starting position of the King
      startY - the vertical position of the starting position of the King
      endX - the horizontal position of the ending position of the King
      endY - the vertical position of the ending position of the King
      Returns:
      true if castle move completes successfully, false otherwise

    • pawnmove

      public static boolean pawnmove​(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Function to handle pawn movement, called from move. Pawn movement is evaluated from specified starting position to ending position and board is updated only if movement is valid.
      Parameters:
      startX - the horizontal position of the starting position of the pawn
      startY - the vertical position of the starting position of the pawn
      endX - the horizontal position of the ending position of the pawn
      endY - the vertical position of the ending position of the pawn
      Returns:
      true if move is valid pawn move and can be executed, false otherwise.

    • getLegalMoves

      public static directions[] getLegalMoves​(int startX, int startY)
      Finds and returns all legal moves of Piece at specified coordinates.

      Determines directions from Piece.getMoves() which returns class specific array of directions , and then extends them for unbounded pieces. If piece is King, determines whether castling move has/can be performed.

      Parameters:
      startX - the horizontal position of the starting position
      startY - the vertical position of the starting position
      Returns:
      an array of directions for all legal moves (empty if none exists)

    • checkcheck

      public static boolean checkcheck​(boolean white)
      Verifies if the player specified is in check by looking at all possible moves for the other player.
      Parameters:
      white - the player color to be checked (white if true)
      Returns:
      true if the player is in check, false if player is not in check

    • inbound

      public static boolean inbound​(int x, int y)
      Checks if specified coordinates are within the bounds of the board and returns true if they are.
      Parameters:
      x - the horizontal coordinate to be checked
      y - the vertical coordinate to be checked
      Returns:
      true if coordinate is on the board, false if they are not

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      Prints the chess board and also prompts the player that it is now their turn
